pageContext.claim: “I think we are going to be very good with the coronavirus. I think that, at some point, that's going to sort of just disappear, I hope.”
pageContext.analysis: Administration public health officials have disputed Trump’s predictions that the novel coronavirus will disappear on its own, which appeared to be rooted in the idea that flu season in the United States generally ends as warmer weather begins in the spring and summer. Asked whether he agreed that the new coronavirus would be gone by April (an earlier version of this Trump claim), Robert Redfield, the director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, told Congress he did not. “Prudent to assume this pathogen will be with us for some time to come,” he said.
